file_content.text: Thanks again. We can finally get these convoys moving.
Are those the shrapnel mines? Thanks. Those things were tearing us to shreds.
Brag about me.
You can count on it.
I need more than "thanks."
I contacted my commanding officer. I'm authorized to pay out a few credits, just as a way of saying thanks.
It was nothing.
Come on, boys. We have our opening. Don't let the Republic get comfortable again!
Until we get rid of that Republic ambush, we'll never get our convoys through.
Blasted Republic ambush! That's the third convoy we've lost this week.
My lord, don't take this wrong, but if someone doesn't take care of that ambush, you can just give Taris back to the Republic.
Agent, you know anything about dealing with ambushes?
Hunter, you have much experience taking out ambushes?
How's your experience with ambushes?
Defeating the Republic is a matter of staying two steps ahead and being five times more ruthless.
I can handle the Republic.
Sounds like you know what you're doing.
I can make the Republic cower in fear.
The Republic is weak.
Whatever it takes.
Are you looking to hire somebody?
Is this a job?
I don't have much choice.
Infiltrate and destroy. I know what to do.
I know a thing or two.
I take it the Republic is giving you trouble.
Enemy causing problems?
Trouble? That's putting it lightly. Their special forces have the passage completely blocked.
I hate to ask for help. Goes against my pride as a soldier. But we need to get our supply convoys through that passage.
If you could take out the Republic special forces and recover their shrapnel mines for us, I'd owe you.
Don't even ask. [Refuse quest]
All doing it myself has got me is a leg full of shrapnel. We need that passage cleared.
I'm sorry. I don't really have time to chat right now.
